intro: Warneckea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved warneckea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Warneckea microphylla is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
